summary: This is an email exchange between federal prosecutors regarding scheduling grand jury presentations for indictments and witness testimony in June and July 2008. It references sealed and unsealed indictments, including one against Jonathan E. Clark, and mentions multiple witnesses.

persons.name: Jonathan E. Clark
persons.context: Named as the subject of an unsealed indictment (US v. Jonathan E. Clark) to be presented to a grand jury on June 26, 2008.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email requesting grand jury time for indictments and witness testimony, including the case against Jonathan E. Clark.

connections.description: The prosecutor is presenting an indictment against Jonathan E. Clark to the grand jury.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation for US v. Jonathan E. Clark
events.description: A grand jury presentation scheduled for a half-hour in the morning to present an unsealed indictment against Jonathan E. Clark.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentations for Sealed Indictment and Witness Testimony
events.description: A grand jury session scheduled for 2 hours in the morning for a sealed indictment and an additional 2 hours for witness testimony.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: An indictment against Jonathan E. Clark (US v. Jonathan E. Clark) was presented to a grand jury on June 26, 2008, and was not sealed.
A separate sealed indictment was scheduled for grand jury presentation on July 1, 2008.
Witness testimony was also scheduled for July 1, 2008, but the witnesses' names are not provided in the visible text.
The correspondence is between federal prosecutors in the Southern District of Florida (West Palm Beach) regarding grand jury scheduling.
The document indicates active federal grand jury proceedings in June-July 2008 involving multiple cases.
